Against I20050509-2010.

Will attach source file.  Should compile if you have JUnit on your classpath. 
On my system, trying to set a breakpoint on the line "throw new
RuntimeException" within the warning() method writes the following error to the
error log.  Oddly, if the body of the toString() method is replaced by return
null, there is no problem setting the breakpoint.

David, are you going to attach the source file? This looks like a dup of bug   
 91543, it would be great if you had a reproducible test case.

The file that exposes the bug

Sorry, forgot to attach the file.  Unfortunately, of course, this morning after
a hard reboot I'm having problems recreating the bug.  I'll spend another 5-10
minutes to see if I can reproduce it again.  Otherwise, maybe this can at least
be a pointer.

Today, same file, suddenly the context menu item "Toggle Breakpoint" never turns
off breakpoints, only adds them.  So I can add 20 breakpoints to any individual
line in the file.  No other files in the project, just this one.  If it's any
relevance, my source and binaries are in linked folders.  Sorry not to be able
to do more.
